Description: Fragment of tibiotarsus (middle bone-leg) of a duck (Anas sp.); part of a foundation-deposit.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), beneath the SW corner of Chamber 19 C
Curator's comments: Clearly part of the "trifling deposit" beneath the SW corner of the annex C, to the east of the "Qasr", see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p.55 § 54 "...a hole had been scooped out of the sand, cylindrical, 4 to 7 inches from W. face, 10 to 14 inches from S. face, and 1 to 12 inches deep below the base of the brickwork. This hole was filled with charcoal, and burnt bones of a small bird, of which I could preserve only one piece". Bibliography: also mentioned by Weinstein, Foundatins deposits, An Arbor, 1973, p. 327-328. Thanks to Dr Wim Van Neer (Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences) for identification
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 55 § 54)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.55, p.176, pl.18)
